website_summaries.verdict: The Gel Cumulus series has remained a runner favorite, based on the positive reviews the 20th iteration has received. The various structural elements of the shoe have proven their efficiency, while the features have stayed functional. Very few negative opinions surrounded the shoe’s design, and with this, the Gel Cumulus 20 has proven its unwavering reliability.
pros: The Gel Cumulus 20 enabled the feeling of running on soft ground, a user commented
Others likened it to “running on clouds” and “running on marshmallows.”
Various wearers found the sizing to be accurate
The midsole provided sufficient cushioning and underfoot support, according to a runner
The shoe performed great in all-day runs, as well as walking and some light exercises, as experienced by a user
A runner claimed that the shoe offered a secure fit that was not too cramped
Many reviewers found the shoe to be lightweight, and some were happy that it did not weigh the foot down while running
The heel area was very supportive, which was perfect for heel-strikers, said a tester
The mesh upper felt nice on the foot while running in warm weather, a user remarked
Several runners found the outsole to be firm yet flexible
A lot of buyers were happy that the neutral colorways available were easy to pair with outfits
cons: One customer stated that the shoe was stiff at first and needed a break-in period
The Flytefoam® midsole seemed lacking in bounce and liveliness, a reviewer wrote

customer_reviews.title: Love Amazon/Zappos, dislike this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying the ASICS Cumulus shoe for years. They changed the sole for this model (20) and I found it to be much harder than previous versions. I went to a running store and got inserts to make them usable, but I'm stuck for the time being with significant pain in the ball of my foot. I'm very disappointed with this new shoe and will likely move to a different brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DWS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I've been purchasing older versions of this model shoe for a few years now. The gel-cumulus 18 were the only running sneakers I trusted. I was hesitant to try the 20s but after receiving these sneakers and putting about 10 miles the first week I'm amazed at how great of a job Asics did with this upgrade. The fit is great, and for anyone like me who's pinky always manages to poke a hole in sneakers this version seems to have some extra material from the toe cap that wraps over to the outside. Overall great pair of sneakers!
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: what i disliked was spending hours resourcing what type of shoe to by aand these come back as one of the top brands for comfort and stability for heavier set people that walked on the side of the feet these shoes were supposed help correct this issue but didnt work well and the cushioning in these shoes sucked from the start so pretty much wasted $120 on shoes will never buy again
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Asics Show Sizes Have Changed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 12 and Asics have always fit great in the past. But I noticed with this latest pair that they run a little small, especially in the big toe area. Apparently Asics has altered the scale of how they size their sneakers, so I suggest getting a half size larger than normal. I just bought another pair, sized 12.5, and they fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Running shoes
customer_reviews.text: These running shoes fit as expected. I read some reviews that a buyer stated they run small not so. Remember for running shoes to fit perfectly wear a size larger. In my case i got me a 9.5 my dress shoes are 8.5. In the past i had wore a 9.0 Nike and was a little tight. Ever since i got two sizes larger. This pair of ASICS Gel-Cumulus 20 SP Men's Running Shoe are comfortable and light.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Fer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, super light, good support
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these after reading a billion reviews; was between this and the Nimbus 20 (I didn't see a point to buying this year's shoe for extra money). Saw many reviews about people noting the width being narrow and the toe box being tight, but if anything the width seems good to me (and I have wider feet) and the toe box just fine. Coming from a paid of Asics FuzeX Lyte, these have far more support, especially in the heel. Super comfy, well padded, nice and light, and feel like they can stand up to some punishment.
customer_reviews.author: A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice running shoe, good support
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a couple of weeks now and have put on about 50 miles of moderate running (7.5 to 8.5 minute miles). I'm pretty happy. I usually don't shell out this kind of money for a running shoe since I go through them regularly. However, these have a very nice support in the heel and my toes are not swimming in the box. I've used them in very hot weather, and they became saturated with moisture at one point. It only took a couple of hours to dry out and they continue to be in good shape. I've been with Asics for a while now. I've tried other shoes, but keep coming back to them.
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: Great show, but...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shoe because I over-pronate. It's been VERY good for this! I was feeling really good about this particular shoe, until just 2 days ago, when a piece of the sole tread came unglued. Really? I would expect this from an off brand shoe, but not from ASICS, an actual running shoe. I'd probably give a different pair a try, if the price were right, but I made the switch from Brooks to this ASICS, and I might be going back to Brooks. Never had this issue with their shoes in the past 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Endless Summer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes! But ASIC is changing the Cumulus lineup
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are significantly lighter in weight than the past 7+ generations of Gel Cumulus shoes - which leads me to believe that there is less Gel in them. The Gel that is usually visible on the front of the shoes in the ball of your foot area is gone. The "flylite" foam that they are now using may be the contributor to the lack of weight, but one thing I did like from these shoes were that they were sturdy, rigid, and had some good weight and gel to them...we'll see how they fair this year.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: More Narrow than hoped
customer_reviews.text: My feet are a touch wider than normal. Some brands regular fits my wide feet and other brands I need to get EE width. Asics apparently need the wider. Not as comfortable or supportive as I'd hoped. To be honest, a pair of Saucony I bought on a whim on sale are far more comfortable and better for running than these Asics...and I've always been an Asics fan...
customer_reviews.author: JPK17

customer_reviews.title: Knees are in agonizing pain
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Asics shoes for approximately 15 years. This is the worst model. I started wearing Asics due to the comfort and fit of the sneakers. Unfortunately the prior models I have worn are no longer available on the market so I went with this new model of the sneaker. I have worn this model for two weeks and my knees are in agonizing pain and swollen. Most likely do to the new souls that they integrated into this model very hard sole and not like the other models. Buyer beware if you have knee ankle foot hip or back issues. The sneaker model definitely will not help your situation.
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves them
customer_reviews.text: My husband is so picky with shoes and told me just to find him a pair. I ended up going with these and he loves them! The color looks so nice. I got him a 10.5 and they fit him perfectly thats what he usually wears. They are comfortable on his feet and doesnt make his feet tired. I love that they have a little padding around the ankle or back of the heel so it doesn't rube. These are amazing I bought the same kind but in woman's and also love them. I've never had a more comfortable pair of shoes neither had he! Will be using asic for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Brit8977

customer_reviews.title: They Break in Beautifully
customer_reviews.text: They come stiff, but after the first 12-15 miles, they break in beautifully. They are light with a significant amount of support and "bounce" and make a daily 3-5 mile run pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DX

customer_reviews.title: Good out of the box, irritating that strings are too short- a typical ASICS issue
customer_reviews.text: Got them today so this is first impression: definitely narrower than any other pair of ASICS I’ve had, which is ok for me but it’s different. The circumference of the shoe around the foot is very small as I’ve had to let the strings out a lot and of course now the shoe strings are too short- I HATE this yet will restring and skip a section. Heel base is wide and stable. Beware, the white color isn’t really white but more a silver/gray. UPDATE: have run and walked in them- super comfortable and great shoe... the issue I still have are the too-short shoe strings... argh!
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: I am now running like I did before my SURGERY
customer_reviews.text: Best Shoe I have ever worn. Been suffering from the effect of my Meniscus Surgery, and I could run as much as I did before the surgery. Tried a varieties of shoes with my brace but nothing work or I experienced knee swelling after running. I put on the Cumulus and I swear there has NOT been any PAIN or swelling. I had ordered two pairs of another style when I ordered my Cumulus. On Tuesday, I paid the shipping fee to return those shoes. I AM A CUMULUS MAN FOREVER..
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as 19
customer_reviews.text: I had 19's and they were some of the best shoes I ever had. Bought these due to wide feet and chronic heel pain. Helped a lot, then after a year or so I upgraded to the 20's. They didn't feel as comfortable, were not as breathable as 19's, and after a while they began to smell bad inside - even after continual use of sneaker spray. The support in these didn't last as long as the 19's and ended up replacing after about 6 months as they did not hold up as well and became uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: OAoa

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite pair of ASICS...
customer_reviews.text: I tried several athletic shoe brands and I seem to always come back to ASICS as my favorite. This shoe however seemed a bit tight (narrow). Not terrible, but noticeable. I am hard on shoes. I wear them out very quickly. This shoe was quicker than most. Notably, the tread or bottom of the shoe was showing signs of wear after a couple of weeks. The shoes felt like they had lost a significant amount of cushioning after maybe a month. Replace these with a different pair of ASICS (that are wonderful) in less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo509

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, with all day foot support
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes. He says they're comfortable, with all day foot support. He has 2 other pairs of this same model in other colors. He really likes the color of this bright blue pair.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Constant squeak.
customer_reviews.text: Asics line has really hit a dead end for me. Have been wearing their shoes for 40 years, but seems like they are making cheaper shoes at higher prices. The Cumulus 20 may be last pair I ever buy. PROS: hmmm.... not sure, maybe that they look good. CONS: Squeak badly with every step - even after months of around home wear and silicon spray seems to offer only a temporary solution, tight. uppers a bit low, uncomfortable if worn too long, durability questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Tycho

customer_reviews.title: Good supportive shoe
customer_reviews.text: Been using them for a few months now with no problems. This is actually my second pair, amazon had them formless than the asics outlet. I have pretty flat feet and I have found the cumulus to be the most comfortable shoe for me. I generally run a few miles 3 times per week and wear these for light walking and whil in the gym. I really like these and would order again. I've found that they tend to run a little small, so if you're between sizes, go with the bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe For Walking After Break In.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very comfortable shoe for the walking I do. It does fir tight for the shoe size though so be warned. Not as bad as some I've tried but enough to be careful about. Otherwise as the show has broken in it has become my go to shoe because it gives good support, fits good without slipping and leaves my feet, joints and legs feeling good instead of sore.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID C.

customer_reviews.title: nice shoeas
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn these for a few weeks; so too soon to give a long-term review. Shoes look good, seemed to be good quality so far, and are comfortable. I am no marathon runner. These shoes seem great for me (average adult male, fairly active) - can't speak for serious runners. In the past, I have really liked ASICS shoes. So far, I am really liking this pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Allaw

customer_reviews.title: A suitable replacement
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes, but the first ones I bought online and couldn't try on first. The materials are a little different, which is maybe why they seem a little stiffer and more snug than my previous pair. But I've given them a pretty good road test at this point, and they're taking pretty good care of me. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Muller

customer_reviews.title: One gets the impression that this is a fake!
customer_reviews.text: Sneakers of different quality. Left - awful! Right - normal. One gets the impression that this is a fake! I am sure that I will not buy anything from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Sokolov

customer_reviews.title: Not a Substitute for the Nimbus
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind this review is based on me looking for a more economical version of the Nimbus. Moving down from the Nimbus, the sizing is noticeably different. The Cumulus is a bit bigger. It’s a much flatter shoe than the nimbus as well. Comparatively, the arch support feels non existent. Other than that, I’m sure the shoe is great for it’s intended fit. The durability is what it is with the current ASICS line. Probably ok for a distance runner, but not durable at all for a pole vaulter who does a ton of sprint drills, plyos, etc. Like the nimbus, the sole on the forefoot gets destroyed in about 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Old Vaulter

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Asics for running for years and the Cumulus models have been great for me. The 20 fits me perfectly. The arch support is comfortable. The sole and cushioning works well for a heel striker like I am. The ball does have good cushioning too. The 20 is definitely an improvement over the 19. Haven't looked at the 21s.
customer_reviews.author: B. C. Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Consistently good
customer_reviews.text: Gel cumulus works well for my feet and running style. I’m a loyal customer across generations. Orthotics fit well. No extra support needed. Has decent forefoot cushioning for a forefoot strider. After 250 miles the cushioning is less and the soles start to show wear, but they can still go another 100+ miles with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are little heavy, but I needed more cushion, so I guess the trade off is worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: James D

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: The fit was ok, but the quality is not the same. I wore the shoes around the house for several hours without any real pain. Then I wore them for about eight hours while driving and walking, my feet hurt so bad in the arch and heel. Then I put my spenco inserts in them the nest day and tried again. Arch and heel pain again. I have worn the Asics Cumulus for years working 12 hour shifts and never had problems, I think the quality has changed. And I wasted my money on these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: asics  shoes
customer_reviews.text: i have 2 pairs of shoes i change them every other day I am not a runner except when i am walking my young english setter pup then you know what you are seeing when you are not the lead dog I got the shoes because our son who runs 5 miles every advises us they are his shoe of choice
customer_reviews.author: amparo

customer_reviews.title: Another great pair of Asics
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Cumulus (plus one pair of Nimbus). I love these shoes. They are light, fit great and are like walking and running on clouds. I bought these to replace a different, very popular brand, that I absolutely hated, but were on sale. I have no intentions of not buying Asics in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Asics has been my "go to" sneaker for nearly 40 years and I've rarely been disappointed. These shoes were priced very well so I took a chance--and I love them. I only use them for walking, but I walk a lot and I love the all-around comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Wear out immediately
customer_reviews.text: The hardest use these shoes see is walking my dogs, I definitely walk at a fast pace, but that is no excuse for the front toe to wear so quickly on the sidewalk. I can't imagine these lasting me more than 3 months, even less if I was running on the sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: john anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and an Understated Look
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these shoes for a Class Reunion this summer(40th)to go with khaki pants and a polo shirt. Have worn Nike shoes since high school, but this is my second pair of Asics in the last 6 months and I do enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Malek

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe but fits small
customer_reviews.text: The shoe size is smaller than as advertised. I have had numerous size 13M shoes and they fit fine and some of them big. But this one was very tight from the get go and I couldn't get my foot into it without forcing it. Which then made the shoe uncomfortable. I did go ahead and get the new wider size which seems to fit a bit better but still need to test out for more than 30 seconds for a good review.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little narrow
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this sneaker style so I hunted everywhere to try to find it. I ordered extra wide thinking it was 4EE but it isn’t. So the sneaker is a little tight. It will loosen as he wears them so we aren’t sending them back but will know for next time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: The ASICS Men's Gel-Cumulus 20 shoe fits well. The shoes look great and has good support. The price was much better than I could find locally or online.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothie King

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoes but one major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the soles and arch of these shoes feel. My one gripe is that the construction around the opening of the shoes is too hard and thick on the sides. It rubs on my ankle and is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L.

customer_reviews.title: W is not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I don't consider my feet to be exceptionally wide but the W in this brand is not enough for me. Nice shoe otherwise, though!
customer_reviews.author: mauryrol

customer_reviews.title: good daily trainer
customer_reviews.text: I have had Cumulus shoes in the past. I have liked them all and these work well. It took me a little longer than expected to break them in but give them a week or two and you will be fine. Of course there are many better shoes out there but if you are pinching pennies then give these a try. Use them as a daily trainer and if you end up like me and are training for a big event months down the line then save now and "earn" a better pair closer to race day.
customer_reviews.author: Shane p

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for people with narrow feet and high arch
customer_reviews.text: Even though the Cumulus is a D width, it runs narrow. In fact, it's the only running shoe(including other Asics models) that fit my feet. On the computer measuring machine, it shows that my arches don't touch the ground. I can walk forever in these shoes with no discomfort. They are light with lots of cushion, yet I still feel connected to the ground unlike sole inserts.
customer_reviews.author: John Karsten

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I had this model that I bought last year. It was a no-brainer to purchase again since the shoe worked for me very nicely and was comfortable and I knew the size would be right. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great Athletic Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Been using these 5 days a week since I got them and they are holding up great. Great show for someone with flat feet. Bought them after doing a lot of website research on them and got a great deal on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: B. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Support is not removeable
customer_reviews.text: I have heel spurs so I was really hoping this brand/style would work. Unfortunately for me they don't and I can't remove the support to insert my own so these have to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow for Me
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned these shoes because they were too narrow for me and I purchased them in wide. However, I have a challenge finding good fitting shoes. I have given them 4 stars because they seem to be fine otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: returning customer
customer_reviews.text: I run around 5 days a week - between 3 & 5 miles a day, all year round. These shows last me around a year which is generally between 1000 and 1200 miles. By the end of that they've lost a lot of their bounce, but I still find them very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: John Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: Fit well and feel nice, break-in was slow but they’re getting there.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good Pair
customer_reviews.text: At 240lbs with some knee pain, I've got some heavy steps when I run. These shoes have held their support and comfort with pretty regular wear both casually and actively. Definitely recommend them
customer_reviews.author: GodzillaJon

customer_reviews.title: Not like my old pair
customer_reviews.text: The feel of walking wasn't a true gel experience. I have an older pair of ASICS that I return to more then the new pair, which tells you this new pair of shoes didn't grab me. Wanted but couldn't find a good replacement for the cross trainers I did have
customer_reviews.author: Tony p

customer_reviews.title: my new go to shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid running shoe, cushioned and feels good. There is a little bit of a breakin period, but these are my new go to shoes for cushion and support
customer_reviews.author: Poseidon

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my dad and he loves them. Easily one his favorite pair of sneakers that he owns. Comfortable and they look great. They’re a neutral shoe so the arch support is moderate. If you’re someone with low arches, you’ll have to insert insoles to add support.
customer_reviews.author: Chinelo A.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been running in ASICS for a long time now, but these gel 20s are about the best running shoes I’ve had as so far. Really,as far as size and fit, so happy with these. I’m about a 1000 miles a year runner changing shoes every 500 , like I said , best pair of ASICS yet. They did good with these.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Kane

customer_reviews.title: cushioning of shoes acceptable
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with the fitting of these shoes. The width is a touch small and it took a while for the fitting to come true. On the whole, the shoes are acceptable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cheng

customer_reviews.title: MUCH MORE BLUE IN PERSON
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a review on running with them because they just came in. It's a review on the color I ordered. I ordered the ones that look kind of purple and kind of blue (at least to me). They are actually super blue, hopefully I don't get shot in my neighborhood rollin around in these. Ordered wide and they fit like a glove for my wide feet. Major points on that.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Salazar

customer_reviews.title: ASICS Men's Gel-Cumulus 20 Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes- I did my first workout in them today and my feet felt good. If I nit-pick I would prefer a different color but overall this is a good pair of shoes- I have bought this model shoe the past four years now and they are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ironland

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I roll to the outside of my foot and this shoe helps minimize that. finding a shoe that will last can be difficult. This pair and my last pair outlived my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: PAC

customer_reviews.title: A good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 9.5 wide got 9.5 regular fit. It's not enough to send them back. Just laced sneaker different to get a looser fit. Everything else is what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like the arch support in ASICS shoes and have worn out many pairs over the years. These fit as specified except the toe box is just a touch too narrow for my gunboats, but better than loose for walking stability and they'll break in. The soles are bright orange, so I definitely won't get lost in a crowd.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Rininger

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for feet that roll out, not inwards
customer_reviews.text: A very highly rated shoe from professional reviewers. I had added this to my notification list. I have a typical slightly above Kiwi (New Zealand citizen) foot width compared to eeuropeans. This Asics shoe fits perfectly & offers the correct support to limit my ankles rolling outwards.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Vercoe

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 extra
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair and it fit and performed well. I bought 2 extra so I can have them when this shoe is discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Shoes offer reasonable support but run small to my normal size. If I ever thought about adding inserts for additional support, forget it, they squeeze too much now.
customer_reviews.author: P. Erbe

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, not as wide as expected, but with longer laces it works. Good support for feet.
customer_reviews.author: c.porter

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, excellent buying experience
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in this model of shoe for 10+ years. I know the size I need and how it should feel when I run in it. The latest model I ordered is perfect. The service I received on the order was great. I actually received it a day earlier than I was promised. A++
customer_reviews.author: Adam Iker

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor brisk walks and slight running
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for outdoor use since I use a very expensive pair of Asics on my treadmill, I did a search for best outdoor sneakers for fast walks and periodic jogging. This model came back as the number one. Fit perfectly. Have had them for several weeks and have used them daily. In summary, just what I wanted. Excellent choice. My wife purchased the women's sneaker and loves it just as much.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Turino

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is my favorite. I had tried on a previous year in a running store, and have stuck with these for 2 different purchases now. This shoe fit me as well (or better) than the last generation that I ordered. Overall I am happy with this shoe, and wouldn't hesitate to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe. Ok fit, little tight.
customer_reviews.text: Tried it on at a store, decided to buy. Much tighter fit, hope it loosens over time. Very challenging to work with seller.
customer_reviews.author: cuponjim

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: great shoe, fits like i wanted it too, super comfortable to walk in. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Gave these as a gift
customer_reviews.text: And the recipient loves them. Uses the shoes several times a week at the gym. Asics makes in my opinion the best running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kmasse

customer_reviews.title: Great price/quality. Too narrow. Go for 1/2 size up
customer_reviews.text: Go for half size up. Too tight and narrow. Other than that, Gel Cumulus model is a great running shoe. I run 50-60 miles per week.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Lacambra

customer_reviews.title: not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: the shoes look quite good. for me they were not that comfortable to exercise with... i would get back pain after using them...
customer_reviews.author: ARBEN CAMAJ

customer_reviews.title: Asics are a high quality value.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this older model was available. I saved big bucks buying last years' model instead of this years'. It arrived in a timely manner and was easy to return another item that shipped at the same time. A good shoe so far. I switched from Brooks back to Asics mostly because of cost. they are both great shoe makers so I let cost determine which way I wanted to go.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Brennan Panama City History Professor

customer_reviews.title: Support and comfort meet for the runner
customer_reviews.text: I find ASICSs tend to wear a tad small and a little bit narrower than equivalent sizes in other shoes. However, they last and support well, while delivering a comfortable feel. I love the Nimbus and really like the Cumulus. I went with the Cumulus this time because of the great deal I got. Being a 230 lb runner, I need all the support I can get, and ASICS does the trick. They take the punishment I give them for 600+ miles.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Bohner

customer_reviews.title: To small
customer_reviews.text: I've worn the same size asics for years 11.5, now they have this new "better fit" sizing means I'm probably a 12 wide...
customer_reviews.author: Turner

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to real US Men's sizes!
customer_reviews.text: Runs REALLY SMALL (1-2 full sizes down!) Upon receiving the package I was pretty excited. I generally don't buy things like this online. Yet, as soon as I opened it up and took the shoe out I could tell it was WAY too small to be a size 8 US in Men's. Not even close. I couldn't even fit my foot into these damn things. I guess I'll stick to irl shopping at UnderArmor or Reebok..
customer_reviews.author: Luis C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes for outside work on my pool route. They relieve the discomfort I get from supination and plantar issues. They fit as expected, giving me just enough spring and comfort for my long days. Would recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: adam mineo

customer_reviews.title: Life time user
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Asics Shoes for 30+ years. And, I have been wearing the Cumulus Model for 10 years or more. I have tried other brands but I always come home to Asics. They are the best of me.
customer_reviews.author: Rainey Woods

customer_reviews.title: Like the shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Good looking shoes. Feel very light. Rode a bit high on the outer edge and rubbed on my ankle bones, but has gone away as they are broken in.
customer_reviews.author: I M Hop

customer_reviews.title: Good value- comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good price for shoes. Asics are most comfortable- cumulus 20 are very comfortable. Good padding & support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for roofing
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t get these for running, but for walking on asphalt shingles and they work very well. Shoes were true to the size labeled on them and fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Consistant quality
customer_reviews.text: It's great to know that ASICS are consistant as I was able to order the same shoe as before with only a change in color. I put several hundred miles of jogging on the first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hop

customer_reviews.title: Started breaking down after less than 50 miles
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in March, ran around 50 miles on them, and pieces of the bottom started falling off. I should have read the reviews here before buying because it looks like a lot of people have had these issues. I don’t know what the deal is. I’ve always like ASICS and I like the shoe otherwise, but for this money I’ll be taking my business elsewhere (like Brooks).
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for underpronators (supinators)
customer_reviews.text: If your shoes wear out on the outer edges, then you're likely a supinator like me. This shoe has extra cushioning and gel on the outer edges of the shoe to reduce impact. My supination makes me very prone to painful and annoying shin splints, but the Cumulus shoes mitigate the pain quite a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Brad T

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the front and rear support in the sole. It fits as expected as I have used Asics for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. Last year's model is always way cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes for me. They are flat soled, which is great if you use orthotics. I've been wearing the gel-cumulus for almost 15 years and they are great.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Hello bootcamp!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these babies for my metabolic bootcamps at work in which we do a ton of running. I’ve always trusted Asics to do the job and these yellow jackets don’t disappoint. I’m thinking of buying another pair already!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Love them...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Fit as expected. I'm heavy and I love the gel shoes. Also good looking. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mc4

customer_reviews.title: Buy big
customer_reviews.text: I tried these first in a 12.5 instead of a 12 because I read they could be a bit snug. Had to teturn those as they were a bit snug and the arch fit me wrong. These 13s are perfect. Very nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: bertrarious

customer_reviews.title: Acids comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, I have been wearing these shoes for years and they feel great from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne W.

customer_reviews.title: No need to buy current model
customer_reviews.text: Great deal buying the previous model. I’ve tried ON and Hokas but really just like the ASICS. Really should have bought 2 pairs at this price $48.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hohler

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Aisics for years. Great shoe. I have always worn an 8 1/2, but this time they were a bit tight. The 9's fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed new shoes for work and for the gym and he is very pleased with the 2 pairs of adidas that I ordered for him. They fit well, are very comfortable and after 8 to 10 hours on his feet on concrete floors they are still comfortable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Sage

customer_reviews.title: ASICS have been my choice of running shoes for 35 years.
customer_reviews.text: Too soon to tell. Tried on and seem to be fine. Maybe a bit on tight side but will probably be better when I wear. Been wearing ASICS for 35 years and love them. My only complaint is quality not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Asics Cumulus. Consistent since 10+ years
customer_reviews.text: I love the consistency, the quality and the price. Definitely one of the best running brands out there. KEEP IT UP!!!
customer_reviews.author: Turdytree

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after starting to run again. Was previously wearing an old pair that were hurting my ankles. These were a perfect upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: D.hogan

customer_reviews.title: very hard heal on inside rendered shoe unwearable
customer_reviews.text: I have run in Asics for many years and have never experienced this problem before. I returned the shoes for a full refund and went back to my Asics 19 that I have run with successfully for a few years now.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Great seller/great product
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are great. They fit properly as expected. I'll keep buying them for my running sessions. Must have 👌
customer_reviews.author: Julio Báez

customer_reviews.title: Cheap soles
customer_reviews.text: Did not last for a full summer of running. Only dry conditions. Also had a second pair of shoes that I did not run in.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pokorney

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Never used cumulus before, didn’t like the flat bottoms, felt narrow in the toe box and a little short, nice lite shoe but no comparison to Kayano 25
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoe I have had
customer_reviews.text: Very well made show. A lot of cushion and no break in period. Excellent for underpronators.
customer_reviews.author: thedocj

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is key
customer_reviews.text: You can feel the gel insole when you run. Definitely superior to the shoes I was running in before. These were a good buy and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Rolen Paypaz

product_meta.title: ASICS - Mens Gel-Cumulus® 20 (2E) Shoes
product_meta.description: With an increased landing surface to accommodate every foot strike, the premium feel and fit of the GEL-CUMULUS 20 men's performance running shoe produces a gentler, more comfortable ride as you run further than ever before. Featuring FLYTEFOAM propel technology for optimal bounce-back, a full-ground contact outsole for smoother heel-to-toe movement and SPeVA insole material that provides ample room in the ball girth and toe area. The new rolled collar provides a sleeker silhouette, while the ORTHOLITE sockliner and GEL technology cushioning system mean you can go the extra mile in comfort. Weight: 10.05 oz. Heel Height: 23mm. Forefoot Height: 13mm.
feature_bullets: I.G.S (Impact Guidance System) Technology - ASICS design philosophy that employs linked componentry to enhance the foot's natural gait from heel strike to toe-off.
SpevaFoam 45 Lasting - Employs 45 degree full length SpevaFoam 45 lasting material for a soft platform feel and improved comfort.
Reflectivity - Contains reflective materials designed to enhance visibility during low light hours.
Ortholite Sockliner - Moisture management (Ortholite is a registered trademark of ATP Manufacturing LLC).
FlyteFoam Propel Technology - ASICS energetic foam formulation that provides supreme bounce thanks to a unique elastomer compound.
